keyTakeAways: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American, has been detained in Israel since February 2023 and is being held in Israeli prisons under harsh conditions including cold cells, insufficient meals, and lack of medical care.

The United States has provided over $21 billion in aid to Israel over the past two years, yet the Trump administration has not used this leverage to secure Mohammed’s release despite his status as a US citizen.
Israel is the only country known to systematically prosecute children in military courts, raising global human rights concerns.

Mohammed claims he was beaten by Israeli soldiers during arrest and has been charged with throwing stones at settlers, a charge he denies, while legal experts say Palestinians in West Bank detention rarely receive fair trials.

The case has drawn international attention from human rights groups like Defense for Children International – Palestine (DCIP), US lawmakers, and activists, who argue that the US must intervene to protect a minor citizen.
At least 79 Palestinian detainees have died in Israeli jails since October 2023 due to lack of medical care, food, and torture, indicating a systemic pattern of abuse in Israeli detention facilities.

The recent Gaza ceasefire deal and prisoner exchange have reignited calls to release Mohammed, as freed captives have described torture and execution, increasing global scrutiny of Israeli treatment of Palestinian detainees.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American citizen, has been detained in Israeli prisons since February 2023 following a raid on his family’s home in the West Bank. He has described being beaten during arrest and enduring harsh conditions including cold cells, inadequate meals (such as three pieces of bread and a spoonful of labneh for breakfast), and no fruit or dinner. Despite being a US citizen and with advocacy from human rights groups like Defense for Children International – Palestine (DCIP) and US lawmakers, including Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley, he remains detained. Israel is the only country known to prosecute children in military courts, and at least 79 Palestinian detainees have died in Israeli jails since October 2023 due to lack of medical care and torture. The case has gained renewed attention following the Gaza ceasefire deal and prisoner exchanges, prompting calls for the US to use its leverage to secure his release. Critics argue that even with $21 billion in US aid, the Trump administration has not intervened, highlighting systemic human rights violations in Israeli detention facilities.
title: Cold cells, meagre meals: Palestinian American boy suffers in Israeli jail
